event.title: was surpassed by the more prosperous village of Sutton, now

data.event: This settlement continued as a trading post for the Roman Empire, until it was surpassed by the more prosperous village of Sutton, now called Plymouth.
In 1620, the Pilgrim Fathers departed Plymouth for the New World and established Plymouth Colony – the second English settlement in what is now the United States of America.

event.title: – the second English settlement in what is now

data.event: In 1620, the Pilgrim Fathers departed Plymouth for the New World and established Plymouth Colony – the second English settlement in what is now the United States of America.

event.title: 1914 three neighbouring independent towns, viz., the county borough of Plymouth, the county borough of Devonport, and the urban district of East Stonehouse were merged

data.event: In 1914 three neighbouring independent towns, viz., the county borough of Plymouth, the county borough of Devonport, and the urban district of East Stonehouse were merged to form a single County Borough.

event.title: took the name of Plymouth which, in 1928

data.event: The combined town took the name of Plymouth which, in 1928, achieved city status.

event.title: led to the incorporation of Plympton and Plymstock along with other outlying suburbs in 1967

data.event: After the war the city centre was completely rebuilt and subsequent expansion led to the incorporation of Plympton and Plymstock along with other outlying suburbs in 1967.
